title: 111_s1520
content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation with purposes outlined in its articles of incorporation, constitution, and bylaws, including upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered corporation with purposes that include upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States, uniting American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, advocating for all veterans regardless of service time, and promoting social welfare. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to advocate for American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, promote social welfare, and support their needs in dealings with government agencies. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated advocates for American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, supports their needs with government agencies, promotes research on their relationship with American society, and provides technical assistance to tribes without veterans committees. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated supports American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans by providing outreach services, training Tribal Veterans Service Officers, and ensuring membership and board of directors follow the constitution and bylaws of the corporation. The board of directors and officers of the corporation must adhere to the constitution, bylaws, and laws of the jurisdiction. Membership and leadership roles cannot discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age. The corporation must adhere to nondiscrimination policies in membership and leadership roles, and has exclusive rights to certain names and symbols. The corporation has exclusive rights to use specific names, seals, emblems, and badges. It is restricted from issuing stock, paying dividends, or distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. The corporation is prohibited from issuing stock, paying dividends, or distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. It cannot make loans to any of its officials and must maintain its tax-exempt status. The corporation is prohibited from making loans to its officials and must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It is also not allowed to claim congressional approval or Federal Government authority for its activities. Additionally, the corporation must keep accurate records of accounts, meeting minutes, and member information at its principal office. The corporation must maintain accurate books and records of accounts, meeting minutes, and member information at its principal office. Members with voting rights or their representatives can inspect these records for any proper purpose at any reasonable time. This provision does not override the laws of the jurisdiction where the corporation is incorporated or operates within the United States and its territories. Sec. 150412. Service of process: The corporation must comply with the laws of the jurisdiction where it is incorporated and operates within the United States and its territories for service of process. Sec. 150413. Liability for acts of officers and agents: The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers and agents when they are acting within their authority. Sec. 150414. Failure to comply with requirements. The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers and agents when they act within their authority. Failure to comply with requirements may result in the expiration of the charter. The corporation must report annually to Congress on its activities during the previous fiscal year. The charter granted by this chapter shall expire if there is a failure to comply with requirements. The corporation must report annually to Congress on its activities during the previous fiscal year. The charter granted by this chapter shall expire if there is a failure to comply with requirements. The corporation, National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated, must report annually to Congress on its activities during the previous fiscal year. 1504.
